name: Aragorn Necklace - Tolkien - Spell Cast Gems(tm) Elven Magic Jewelry - Medieval - Fantasy - Filigree
description: This Spell Cast Gems™ “ARAGORN” necklace is: *Lord of the Rings Elven jewelry, designed in a medieval, vintage fantasy setting, with filigree. This necklace has Spell Cast Gems™ magic crystal energy for increased mental focus. It is also an astrological talisman and an amulet – please contact Seller for details. Original art: each item featured in this webpage is handmade and unique. The reverse side of the pendant has a unique magic spell on composite gold leaf – this spell design will not be repeated on another item. Central focal point is a vivid green Looking Glass Pendant™(I manufacture these). This listing also includes optional gemstone engraving and healing energywork. Materials include oxidized brass chain, toggle clasp, genuine aventurine beads, silver foil beads, emerald matte glass beads, clear green glass beads, composite gold leaf, and toxic-free jeweler’s synthetics. Necklace length is adjustable; it can be work as a choker and measures app. 20 inches total length; pendant is app.1 5/8 inches in diameter. ABOUT ARAGORN> In Tolkien’s writings, King Aragorn was a descendant of Lord Elrond Half-elven’s twin brother and the first king of NÃºmenor. Aragorn’s father was killed by Orcs when Aragorn was a child. He was raised by Elrond in Rivendell. Aragorn was tall, and had elven wisdom as well as foresight. He was humble and self-sacrificing, a healer, and a powerful military commander and warrior. He had impressive powers for a man partly because he was Isildur’s heir. When Sauron was defeated, Aragorn was crowned King of Arnor, the thirty-fifth King of Gondor, and the first High King of the Reunited Kingdom. Aragorn married the Elf Princess, Arwen, Elrond’s daughter, and ruled the Kingdom of Gondor and Arnor until the 120th year of the Fourth Age. He died at the age of 210. Arwen died of a broken heart. Materials include genuine aventurine beads, silver foil beads, composite gold leaf, genuine aquamarine, oxidized brass chain, toggle clasp, gold-tone chain, antiqued filigree, and gunmetal chain Necklace length is adjustable; it can be work as a choker and measures app. 20 inches total length; pendant is app.1 5/8 inches in diameter ABOUT QUEEN OLYMPIAS, MOTHER OF ALEXANDER THE GREAT: Historically, Queen Olympias, Mother of Alexander the Great of Macedon, has been greatly maligned. She had a reputation for being a beautiful, scheming sorceress or witch. She was, however, a woman of great strength and assertiveness for her time. Perhaps only a person like Queen Olympias could have given birth and raised a person like Alexander the Great. The only surviving portrait of her is a coin of that time period. One thing is clear: Olympias had to fight, for what she felt was right, in a very chauvinistic society. ABOUT GALADRIEL, ELF QUEEN AND SORCERESS: Galadriel, also known as the Lady of the Golden Wood of Lothlorien, was the most powerful Elf in Middle-earth during the Third Age. Galadriel was very wise. She had knowledge of growing things and crafts. Galadriel had great intuition and could read others’ minds. Although strong-willed, she was very kind, compassionate, and merciful. The beauty of Galadriel was indescribable. Her long, flowing, golden hair had silver highlights, and it resembled the light of the Two Trees of Valinor.
